text.0: for life i set thee free by this oblation from the unknown decline and from consumption.
text.1: or if the grasping demon have possessed him free him from her o indra thou and agni.
text.2: be his days ended be he now departed be he brought very near to death already.
text.3: out of destructions lap again i bring him save him for life to last a hundred autumns.
text.4: with hundredeyed oblation hundredautumned bringing a hundred lives have i restored him.
text.5: that indra for a hundred years may lead him safe to the farther shore of all misfortune.
text.6: live waxing in thy strength a hundred autumns live through a hundred springs a hundred winters.
text.7: through hundredlived oblation indra agni bṛhaspati savitar yield him for a hundred.
text.8: so have i found and rescued thee thou hast returned with youth renewed.
text.9: whole in thy members i have found thy sight and all thy life for thee.
